item.title: Trump confirms he authorised CIA action inside Venezuela
item.description: But the president would not be drawn on whether the CIA had been told to topple Nicolas Maduro.

item.title: Hamas returns two more bodies but says it cannot retrieve remaining dead hostages
item.description: The group's armed wing says it has returned all the bodies of hostages it can reach in the ruins of Gaza.

item.title: Cracked windscreen forces US defence secretary's plane to land in UK
item.description: The Pentagon says Hegseth and other military leaders on board, who were travelling back from a Nato meeting, are safe.

item.title: Syria's Sharaa meets Putin in Moscow for first time since fall of Assad
item.description: Syria's leader suggested he would continue to allow Russia access to its military bases in Syria.

item.title: Ukraine imposes blackouts in most regions after Russian power grid attacks
item.description: This will be the fourth consecutive winter of outages since Russia launched its full-scale invasion in February 2022.
